# pylama

Aggregates results from multiple linters. By default, it runs pyflakes, pycodestyle, mccabe, and combines their output.

```{python}
#| echo: false
# pylint: disable=missing-module-docstring
# Import required packages
import subprocess
import sys

# Add parent directory to sys.path
sys.path.insert(0, "..")

# Import the helper functions
# pylint: disable = import-error, wrong-import-position
# noqa: E402
from helpers import generate_html, print_quarto
```

```{python}
#| echo: false
#| output: asis
generate_html(
    pypi_url="https://pypi.org/project/pylama/",
    github_url="https://github.com/klen/pylama",
    conda_url="https://anaconda.org/conda-forge/pylama"
)
```

## Run pylama using `lintquarto`

```{.bash}
lintquarto pylama general_example.qmd
```

:::{.pale-green}
<style>
.cell-output-stdout code {
  word-break: break-word !important;
  white-space: pre-wrap !important;
}
</style>
```{python}
#| echo: false
result = subprocess.run(
    ["lintquarto", "pylama", "examples/general_example.qmd"],
    capture_output=True, text=True, check=False
)
print(result.stdout)
```
:::
